result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Kurer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
DNA Surcharge and Sample WAIVED.

Cost to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.
Valid prescription to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week
DNA Sample and Surcharge WAIVED.

Defendant Daniel J Kurer in court with attorney David P. Geraghty.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recommendations by the State.  Arguments by the defense.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders the following:
- Total sentence: 3 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year 6 months, Extended Supervision: 1 year 6 months) CONSECUTIVE to any current sentence.  STAYED
- 3 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school.
(2) from Cedar Creek Family Counseling, Inc dated 2/10/15 and 2/15/15
